Query: how to prepare for 3rd party ship inspections?

Confidence: 99% (HIGH üü¢) Sources analyzed: 30

üìù Answer

Based on the documents on file, preparation for third-party ship inspections involves coordinated efforts between the ship's personnel and the Head Office, focusing on documentation, physical readiness, and addressing previous findings.

General Shipboard Preparation (All Personnel)

All ships personnel and officers/crew members must:

  1. Conduct Checks: Carry out preparatory checks and actions to ensure all inspection items under their responsibility are in order before the inspection [1, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Responsibilities; 2, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Pre-Inspection Preparation].
  2. Physical Condition: Ensure the ship is in good cosmetic and maintenance condition [3, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Managing the Inspections].
  3. Professionalism: Appear professionally run, with an advanced safety culture, and wear the appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) [3, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Managing the Inspections].
  4. Documentation Readiness: Ensure that all required records are readily available and well maintained [3, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Managing the Inspections].

Master's Specific Responsibilities

The Master must ensure the ship is always prepared for a prospective inspection during port calls. This includes:

  1. Coordination: Coordinate and verify that pre-inspection checks have been carried out effectively [1, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Responsibilities].
  2. Reporting: Report timely to the Head Office any outstanding issues [1, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Responsibilities].
  3. Certification:
    • Ensure all certificates onboard are valid, endorsed, and readily available for inspection [5, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Surveys and Certification].
    • Keep attached supplements (e.g., Safety Equipment Record) with the corresponding Certificates [5, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Surveys and Certification].
    • Maintain a complete record of past Class surveys onboard [5, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Surveys and Certification].
    • In cooperation with the C/E, update forms D 006A and D 006B, indicating the expiration/renewal dates of the certificates [5, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Surveys and Certification].
    • Send a reminder message/email to the Office for certificates due to expire at least one month before the expiration date [5, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Surveys and Certification].

Office Coordination and Vetting Preparation

The Head Office supports preparation through scheduling, communication, and ensuring compliance:

Office Role Preparation Action Source
Marine / Technical and Quality & Safety Manager Ensure that ships are fully prepared for any third party inspection. [1, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Responsibilities]
Quality & Safety Manager (P&I/Flag Inspections) Communicate the Inspection Checklist to the Master for guidance. [4, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > P&I Surveys], [7, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Flag Administration Inspections]
Technical / Marine S/T Provide the Master with preparatory instructions and request confirmation of readiness for inspection (for P&I and Flag inspections). [4, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > P&I Surveys], [7, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Flag Administration Inspections]
Technical / Marine S/T Send updated Survey Status reports onboard within 7 days before a scheduled vetting inspection. [5, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Surveys and Certification]
HSQE Manager (Vetting Specific) Initiate the pre-vetting process and coordinate with the Master to ensure: positive close out of all previous vetting inspection findings; discussion of any applicable past fleet findings; and close out, where possible, of outstanding findings identified during internal/external audits and inspections. [2, Chapter 18 THIRD PARTY SHIP INSPECTIONS > Pre-Inspection Preparation]
